title: My tendency in the academy is to give more time to teach girls, And I'm jealous when other teachers take more time to teach girls, is it ok? What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hmmm, this is similar to what used to go on at my academy. I don’t give more time to girls, but I have a preference for my girl students, they are adorable and smarter for the most part and the other so-called English teacher gets jealous. He especially gets jealous with the adult students.  That teacher introduced me around 14 months ago, saying he was friends with everyone and there are 4 young, beautiful vocal music teachers he said he was friends with too, but…he’s not. So, over the last year I have all the advanced students, all the adults, including the music teachers next door that come to me for English. What can the other jealous teacher do? Nothing, except on trying to learn to teach more effectively, be humble, and practice his English…it’s lacking to say the least. Also, since I’m Korean and I speak both languages, it’s a “no contest” situation.  My room is always filled with 5–7 students. I teach in and out of the classroom, I reward them with meals, ice cream trips, and take them outside working on applicable English. The bottom line is that I’m more effective and innovative, maybe you can try some new ways to attract students to you!
Spending more time teaching girls is not behaving in an equal manner to both sexes how do you justify that? Maybe a STEM teacher should spend more time teaching men as they built civilisation.
Are you saying you're jealous of other people doing what you're admitting you do yourself? Anyway, why on earth would the girls need extra time?
